found the fix: I just uninstall PulID Flux Enhance.

> found the fix: I just uninstall PulID Flux Enhance.

Thank you. Fix worked for me.
I think so. Not compatible with Fill model.

> I think so. Not compatible with Fill model.

I found a way to work with the fill model that requires twice the weightï¼ˆabove 1.5ï¼‰.

title: Apply pulid flux still applies to the model after disconnecting the link.
body: Why did it apply patches to the checkpoint model? If the weight is 0 or the node is skipped, the face analysis module and EVA clip will still be loaded.
author: Windecay

comments.body:
Hi,

- Weight has nothing to do with how ComfyUI executes the node graph (loading of models, etc.). Node connections do!
- This is an early Alpha version (I have a newer version in the works, with masking and ModelPatcher, but I canâ€™t publish it because itâ€™s not finished).
- About the model patches, see the Known issues section of the readme.txt.

**Patching:** The problem is that ComfyUI currently doesnâ€™t have the right hooks for applying PuLIDAttention embeddings to the model output, so I needed to improvise. This is why I patch the underlying model directly. When I finish the new version of this node, it will hopefully patch and unpatch the model depending on the connection graph.
Thank you very much!

author: InspectaGadget

comments.body:
Hi, you are welcome!

No, this warning message has nothing to do with my â€œhacks.â€ The incompatible_keys.missing_keys are just a warning that multiple keys from the EVA-CLIP model state dictionary were not used/loaded. This info should not normally be displayed to the user by the loader (it should be suppressed), but this is how the EVA-CLIP loader was already set up. I reused the source code. Maybe when I have time, I will look at it, but for now, itâ€™s just a â€œcosmeticâ€ issue. :)
Who ar eyou thankin @balazik ? What is the solution anyway?

@ClothingAI Did you read the issue ? It begins with:

> First I would like to thank you that much as this opportunity of a Comfy implementation you offered us is sooooo awesome !!!!!!
Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks

So I replied.

Solution to what ? Cometic warning messages ? Please read the whole answer. In the issue there are no exception, nor error messages, all are just warnings that are out of my control. The code that generates them is from OpenAI (eva clip loader). I could re-write it but, it it worth my time, no its not, its just cosmetic.

title: Using this custom node via ComfyScript - i am getting very different results than via ComfyUI editor
body:
Here is a minimal example:

```
from comfy_script.runtime.real import *
load()
from comfy_script.runtime.real.nodes import *
import comfy.model_management
from comfy.model_management import xformers_enabled, vae_dtype, get_free_memory
import uuid
import json
import io
import numpy as np
import pdb
import os
import gc
import sys
from torch._C import BoolType
import torchvision.transforms as T
from diffusers.utils import load_image
import cv2
import traceback
from math import atan2, pi, ceil
import pdb
from PIL import Image, ImageFilter
from typing import Optional
import os
import torch

transform = T.ToPILImage()

def run_pulid():
    with torch.inference_mode():
        noise = RandomNoise(52535031757376)
        model = UNETLoader('flux1-dev-fp8.safetensors', 'default')
        pulidflux = PulidFluxModelLoader('pulid_flux_v0.9.0.safetensors')
        eva_clip = PulidFluxEvaClipLoader()
        faceanalysis = PulidFluxInsightFaceLoader('CUDA')
        image, _ = LoadImage('test.jpg')
        model2 = ApplyPulidFlux(model, pulidflux, eva_clip, faceanalysis, image, 1, 0, 1, None)
        clip = DualCLIPLoader('t5xxl_fp16.safetensors', 'clip_l.safetensors', 'flux')
        clip_text_encode_positive_prompt_conditioning = CLIPTextEncode("a woman as a pirate sitting on a throne. Behind her is a ship.", clip)
        clip_text_encode_positive_prompt_conditioning = FluxGuidance(clip_text_encode_positive_prompt_conditioning, 3.5)
        guider = BasicGuider(model2, clip_text_encode_positive_prompt_conditioning)
        sampler = KSamplerSelect('euler')
        denoise = 0.95
        sigmas = BasicScheduler(model, 'beta', 20, denoise)
        image3, _ = LoadImage('scene03.png')
        vae = VAELoader('ae.safetensors')
        latent = VAEEncode(image3, vae)
        latent, _ = SamplerCustomAdvanced(noise, guider, sampler, sigmas, latent)
        image4 = VAEDecode(latent, vae)
        for idx, img in enumerate(image4):
            img = transform(img.permute(2, 0, 1))
            path = "./pulid_{idx}.jpg".format(idx=idx)
            img.save(path)
            print("Saved image as:",path)

run_pulid()
```

When I run the nodes in ComfyUI (visually), the pipeline works and I am receiving the correct image.
However running it via ComfyScript, I am getting a complete different picture which looks nothing alike the person. Something is very off.
author: lschaupp

comments.body:
Sorry, but I will be glad when I find time to implement masking features. I canâ€™t deal with another dependency that might mess up my local installation.

From looking at the code, I see you are reusing the same variable/object name (clip_text_encode_positive_prompt_conditioning):
```
clip_text_encode_positive_prompt_conditioning = CLIPTextEncode("a woman as a pirate sitting on a throne. Behind her is a ship.", clip)
clip_text_encode_positive_prompt_conditioning = FluxGuidance(clip_text_encode_positive_prompt_conditioning, 3.5)
```
Isnâ€™t this the last reference to the object? The CLIPTextEncode object could be destroyed in the meantime. Just guessing.
May be when I have some spare time I will look at this.

Thanks for the info.
I have tried your recommendation and it did not have any effect.
Just wanted to make you aware of the issue.
Ok, will try this with the new version (still in works), when I have time. Closing.
I'm glad that you like it, its just a prototype, I still have a long way to go.

title: Question about VRAM and RAM requirements
body: Hi, I would like to know if this implementation has high requirements for system RAM in addition to VRAM. For example, is there a specific amount of RAM needed for it to work properly? Thank you very much for your response!
author: jojotaro1994

comments.body:
Hi, I never measured the RAM requirements. Its relatively hard to do, because depends on what Flux model and what workflow you use.
For example simple workflow with KSampler and flux1-dev-fp8-e4m3fn, t5xxl_fp8_e4m3fn, flux1_vae and pulid flux loaded as 16bit bfloat takes up ~11 to ~16GB RAM (the range because ComfyUI can load and unload models when generating).

But I recomend at least 32GB RAM when you want to play with ComfyUI else it will swap a lot.
There are also many argument flags that you can use to save memory.

My system RAM peaks at 20GB while VRAM peaks at 15+GB during first run and it takes 80 seconds for a 960x1280 image @ 10 steps, Euler + Simple scheduler. My system build: 4060Ti 16GB + 64GB DDR4, Pytorch 2.1.2 + CU 11.8.
No other questions, closing
Hi, have you tried this type of model? I only listed models that I have personally tested, but others might work as well.
I tried some nf4 models, it works fine
@Minamiyama Thanks, for testing I will add them to the supported models in README.
